Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices

summary:
**Key Points:**

1. The aim is to digitize XYZ Bank's manual, paper-based loan application process to reduce frequent errors, poor customer experience, and TAT.
2. An online platform will be created for customers to apply for personal loans, assess their eligibility, upload KYC documents, check application status, and receive approval digitally.
3. The project will include features like Aadhaar/PAN-based pre-fill online loan application, integration with the credit bureau CIBIL, AI-based eligibility/risk assessment, real-time KYC verification, OTP-based e-agreement signing, and core banking integration.
4. Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules, as well as agent-assisted services for Tier 3 regions, will not be included.
5. The project involves key stakeholders like Product Manager Rahul Sharma, Business Head – Retail Lending Priya Iyer, IT Manager Rakesh Sinha, and Compliance Lead Anjali Mehta.
6. System prerequisites including customers having Aadhaar-linked mobile numbers and valid bank accounts.
7. Risks include API access delay to the credit bureau, digital onboarding resistance from customers, and compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines.
  
**Actions:**

1. Finalize the requirements by 15 March 2025.
2. Kickoff the development process by 1 April 2025.
3. Begin UAT by 1 June 2025.
4. Schedule to Go-Live by 1 July 2025.

**Blockers:**

1. Possible delay in API access to credit bureau.
2. Potential resistance from customers who are not comfortable with digital onboarding.
3. Possible sudden changes in compliance due to emerging RBI guidelines. 

**Success Metrics:**

1. Reduction of TAT from 5 days to 2 hours.
2. 80% reduction in manual data entry.
3. 90% accuracy in eligibility checks.
requirements:
**Business Requirements**

1. As a customer, I want to apply for a personal loan online, so that the process is quick, efficient, and less time-consuming.  
   **Acceptance Criteria:** Online loan application feature has been implemented and functional. A customer can fill and submit an online application.  
   **Role:** Customer  
   **Expected Behavior:** On providing necessary details and documents, the system should allow submission of the application.

2. As a customer, I want the system to assess my loan eligibility using AI-based risk assessment, so that I can know my status instantly.  
   **Acceptance Criteria:** The system can make accurate loan eligibility decisions.  
   **Role:** AI system  
   **Expected Behavior:** On providing all the necessary information, the system should assess the eligibility and inform the customer.

3. As a customer, I want an Aadhaar/PAN-based pre-fill for my online loan application, so that the process becomes faster and I can avoid frequent data entry.  
   **Acceptance Criteria:** On providing Aadhaar/PAN number, the system should autofill the respective information in the application.  
   **Role:** Customer  
   **Expected Behavior:** The system should automatically fill in the details using the Aadhaar/PAN number.

4. As a customer, I want to upload my KYC documents online and get real-time verification, so that I don't need to visit the bank physically.  
   **Acceptance Criteria:** Customers are able to upload the necessary documents and the system verifies those in real time.  
   **Role:** System  
   **Expected Behavior:** The system should accept documents upload and perform real-time verification.

5. As a customer, I want to sign the loan agreement digitally using OTP, so that it is convenient and safe.  
   **Acceptance Criteria:** After loan approval, the system should allow OTP-based e-agreement signing.  
   **Role:** Customer  
   **Expected Behavior:** After receiving OTP, customers should be able to confirm their loan agreement.

6. As a customer, I want to check my loan application status online, so that I can stay updated about the progress.  
   **Acceptance Criteria:** Once the application is submitted, the system should allow customers to check application status.   
   **Role:** Customer  
   **Expected Behavior:** The system should provide real-time updates on application status.

7. As a credit bureau CIBIL, I want the bank's system to integrate with my API, so that I can provide the credit history of the applicants.  
   **Acceptance Criteria:** The developed system is fully integrated with CIBIL's API and can fetch data successfully.  
   **Role:** IT Manager Rakesh Sinha  
   **Expected Behavior:** The system should send the required query and be able to receive and decode the response from CIBIL.  

8. As a Product Manager, I want the system to integrate with our core banking system, so that all actions taken on the platform reflect in our banking system.  
   **Acceptance Criteria:** The system is fully integrated with the bank's existing core system.  
   **Role:** Product Manager Rahul Sharma  
   **Expected Behavior:** Any action recorded on the platform should synchronize with bank's system.

## Project Name
Digital Loan Application and Approval System

## Business Requirement Document

### 1. Background

The current loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. The management wants to digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans.

### 2. As-is Process

The as-is process steps are documented below (as-is process diagram):

<<Image>>

### 3. Business Requirements

#### 3.1 Functional Requirements

##### 3.1.1 Process Details

- Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based prefill.
- Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score.
- AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module.
- Real-time KYC document verification (OCR + face match).
- Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication.
- Integration with core banking for disbursement.

##### 3.1.2 Process Steps

- Customer fills online loan application form.
- System fetches credit score from CIBIL.
- System performs eligibility and risk assessment.
- Customer uploads KYC documents for real-time verification.
- Customer receives loan sanction and signs e-agreement via OTP.
- System integrates with core banking for disbursement.

#### 3.2 System Orchestration Requirements

- File Storage: To be defined
- Output File Library: To be defined

#### 3.3 UI/UX Requirements (MVP -1)

- Login Screen: Users are expected to log in using Single Sign-On (SSO) when accessing. This login mechanism enhances security and streamlines the authentication process.
- User Role-Based Access: 
  - Manager Role: Managers should be granted access to cases, empowering them to utilize both the upload and download functionalities of the automation. This role ensures that managerial users have the necessary permissions for case-related activities.
  - Admin Role: Admin access, reserved for select team members, provides comprehensive access to the entire application. This privileged role is designated for individuals who require full control and oversight of the application's functionalities.

#### 3.4 Non-Functional Requirements

- Audit Trail: A comprehensive audit trail will be maintained to track user activities within the application. This includes capturing user-specific information such as usernames, date and time stamps, and the type of activities performed.
- Monitoring and Reporting: The system will collect log data to monitor the number of active users and track individual usernames. Additionally, performance metrics of the application will be recorded.
- Security: User authentication will be implemented using secure protocols. This security measure ensures that only authenticated users with proper credentials can access the application, enhancing overall system security.
- Reliability: The system is committed to maintaining a minimum uptime, excluding scheduled maintenance.

### 4. To Be Process

Anticipated Procedural Steps for MVP -1:

- The Team initializes the application login procedure upon receipt of emails.
- Subsequently, the team systematically transfers files, utilizing them as inputs for the designated tool.

#### 4.1 Process Steps

- Step-by-step guide for process information.

### 5. Assumptions

- Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number.
- System must support English and Hindi.
- Loan disbursement only through verified bank accounts.

### 6. Inclusions and Exclusions

Inclusions of the project are as follows:

- Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based prefill.
- Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score.
- AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module.
- Real-time KYC document verification (OCR + face match).
- Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication.
- Integration with core banking for disbursement.

Exclusions for the project are as follows:

- Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules.
- Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions.

### 7. Data Sources

#### 7.1 Input Data Sources

To be defined

#### 7.1.1 Key Volumetrics of the As-Is User Flow

To be defined

#### 7.2 Output Data Sources

To be defined

### 8. Glossary of Data

To be defined

## Compliance Rules

| Rule ID | Description | Category | Severity | Applicable Standards |
|---------|-------------|----------|----------|-----------------------|
| R1      | All user activities within the application must be tracked and recorded in an audit trail. | Security | High | ISO 27001 |
| R2      | User authentication must be implemented using secure protocols. | Security | High | ISO 27001 |
| R3      | The system must maintain a minimum uptime, excluding scheduled maintenance. | Operational | High | N/A |
| R4      | The system must support English and Hindi languages. | Operational | Medium | N/A |
| R5      | Loan disbursement must only be done through verified bank accounts. | Legal | High | Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Regulations |
| R6      | The system must fetch credit score from CIBIL. | Data | High | Credit Information Companies Regulation Act (CICRA) |
| R7      | The system must perform real-time KYC document verification (OCR + face match). | Legal | High | Know Your Customer (KYC) Regulations |
| R8      | The system must perform AI-based eligibility and risk assessment. | Data | High | N/A |
| R9      | The system must integrate with core banking for disbursement. | Operational | High | N/A |
| R10     | The system must not include home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. | Operational | Medium | N/A |
| R11     | The system must not include agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. | Operational | Medium | N/A |
| R12     | The system must provide role-based access (Manager Role and Admin Role). | Security | High | ISO 27001 |
| R13     | The system must maintain log data to monitor the number of active users and track individual usernames. | Security | High | ISO 27001 |
| R14     | The system must allow loan application form prefill with Aadhaar/PAN. | Data | Medium | Aadhaar Act, 2016 |
| R15     | The system must allow loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. | Security | High | ISO 27001 |
| R16     | The system must ensure that customers have Aadhaar-linked mobile numbers. | Legal | High | Aadhaar Act, 2016 |
